title: Overwolf's In-Game GW2 Apps and App Contest

comments.author: Raif.9507
comments.body:
Hey all, just as an update, I’m the Overwolf Community manager so if you have q’s or want some help just shout out.

Hope to see some new GW2 apps for Overwolf as GW2 is my main game and I would love to see something like an Intothemists app :p

comments.author: Wothor.4781
comments.body:
Well, there’re two timer widgets and I just found out smiley’s gmaps-location has appeared, too.
Seemingly semi-redundantly I happen to code one based off the leaflet variant myself, with some extra fluff like using CrossTalk as position server.

comments.author: Gil.9346
comments.body: Is there a good Overwolf one for WvW?

comments.author: Drakma.1549
comments.body: I would live to be able to use this app and program for it. However, I’ve had an app “pending approval” for the last 4 months.

comments.author: EvilNucca.8371
comments.body: This is a great app but in the next make of it can you make it to where the app can be moved to a second screen instead of on gw2 all the time. I can open the app in another screen but as soon as I switch to gw2 it goes away.

comments.author: Boogeh.2105
comments.body:
Hi guys!

First of all, for those who don’t know Overwolf – it’s an in-game overlay software that supports Skype, TeamSpeak, a web-browser and many other features.

We currently host an ongoing webapp developing contest for our appstore with some great prizes (more info here).

The reason I’m sharing this info with you is to help you guys create great in-game apps for you and your community, as there has been quite a lot of interest from the GW2 community regarding the competition and regarding apps in general, be it by developers or by players, asking for helpful apps.

You can see some already completed apps here and here.

Hopefully you guys find this information useful.
For any additional information regarding the competition, feel free to contact me at: developers [at] overwolf [dot] com.

Best regards,
Yuri Loginov
Appstore Manager
